Define Documentation

#define BUS_RW_BUFFER_SIZE   64

Size of buffer used for reading/writing to data bus.
Should be same as USB FIFO size when this library is used by USB library.

#define FLASH_ASSERT_CS   PORTC.OUTCLR = PIN0_bm

Assert (set low) flash CS pin.
Needs to be modified to match hardware.

#define FLASH_RELEASE_CS   PORTC.OUTSET = PIN0_bm

Release (set high) flash CS pin.
Needs to be modified to match hardware.

AT26DF Command constants

AT26DF Command constants

Function Documentation

uint8_t flashLogData ( uint8_t *  data,
uint8_t  length 
)

Write data to flash memory.
Flash page size (256 bytes) must be evenly divisible by length Function not used by USB library, but used to write data to flash by microcontroller.

Parameters:
dataPointer to buffer from which to write to flash.
lengthNumber of bytes to write to flash.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
uint8_t flashSectorErase ( uint32_t  address,
uint16_t  count 
)

Erase consecutive sectors.
NOTE: Update call to flahshBlockErase_ depending on block size used.
NOTE: Update delay function to produce real delays of 10ms.

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start erase.
countNumber of sectors to erase.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
uint8_t flashSectorRead ( uint32_t  address,
uint16_t  count,
uint8_t(*)(uint8_t *, uint8_t)  write 
)

Read consecutive sectors starting at address.
Function assumes sectors have been previously erased.

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start reading.
countNumber of sectors to read.
writePointer to function to write data bus, which takes pointer to buffer, length, and returns 0 on success.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
uint8_t flashSectorWrite ( uint32_t  address,
uint16_t  count,
uint8_t(*)(uint8_t *)  read 
)

Write consecutive sectors.

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start writing.
countNumber of sectors to write.
readPointer to function to read data bus, which takes pointer to buffer and returns 0 on success.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
void initFlash ( void   )

Configure flash memory interface and unprotect flash memory. Set flash memory logging address to start of logfile.
